title: Mass. school districts cancel classes through Friday amid power outages, snow cleanup
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Several Massachusetts school districts, including Barnstable and Falmouth, cancel classes through Friday due to power outages and snow cleanup.
More than 136,500 remain without power across Massachusetts following Monday's blizzard, mainly in Cape Cod and southeastern regions.
Plymouth North High School serves as a Red Cross shelter amid significant snowstorm impacts, facilitating displaced families and individuals.

title: Man threatens another bus passenger with a gun in East Boston, police say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 26-year-old man was arrested for threatening a passenger with a gun on an MBTA bus in East Boston.
The suspect brandished a .40-caliber Beretta from his waistband during the incident on Meridian Street.
The man had a prior conviction for illegal firearm possession and was taken to MBTA Transit Police headquarters.

title: Explosion and fire at Taunton home seriously injures mother and 2-year-old child
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: An explosion and fire destroyed a Taunton home, injuring a 25-year-old mother and her 2-year-old child.
The mother and child were hospitalized; she sustained severe burns after entering the home to save her child.
The Taunton Fire Department is investigating the explosion that displaced eight residents and damaged nearby homes.

title: Swayman: Team USA ‘should have reacted differently’ to Trump’s joke about US women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman criticized Team USA's reaction to Donald Trump's joke about the U.S. women's hockey team.
Trump invited the women's hockey team to the White House after their Olympic victory; they declined due to prior commitments.
Swayman and Team USA met with Trump at the White House; the women's team plans a future visit.

title: MSPCA-Angell evacuates nearly 50 animals, opens shelter to pets from Cape homes without power
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Nearly 50 animals evacuated from MSPCA-Angell's Cape Cod shelter due to power outage and low fuel supply.
Animals were relocated to Nevins Farm and Boston locations; shelter now hosts pets from homes without power.
Cape Cod shelter serves as temporary housing for pets through MSPCA-Angell's SafePet program amid ongoing outages.

title: A small town arts scene in Vermont is among the best in America, according to USA Today readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Stowe, Vermont ranked No. 9 in USA Today's 2026 10Best Readers’ Choice Awards for small town arts scenes.
Stowe is known for galleries, Spruce Peak Arts, and the annual Stowe Foliage Arts Festival in October.
Vermillion, South Dakota was ranked as the top small town arts scene for its museums and public art.

title: Not in Boston? Your space saver is likely illegal.
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Most Massachusetts cities outside Boston have banned space savers, with fines up to $100 possible for violators.
Boston permits space savers only during snow emergencies and for 48 hours after, excluding Bay Village and the South End.
Cambridge, Somerville, and other cities like Malden and New Bedford strictly prohibit space savers and enforce removal.

title: ESPN insider has Roman Anthony ranked among MLB’s top-10 corner outfielders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Roman Anthony of the Boston Red Sox is ranked No. 7 among MLB corner outfielders by ESPN's Buster Olney.
Anthony posted a .292/.386/.463 slash line with eight home runs in 71 games during his rookie season.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora plans to maintain Anthony as a leadoff hitter due to his .396 on-base percentage.

title: Where do you get a meal for under $20 in Malden?
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader input for meals under $20 in Malden for a new guide.
Malden features diverse dining options including Ethiopian, Asian, and fusion cuisines.
Readers can recommend budget meals by email or a form, potentially featured in the guide.

title: The story behind this viral photo of an unplowed Fall River street
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Fall River's June Street remains unplowed days after a severe blizzard hit Southeastern Massachusetts.
Local residents criticize the city's snow removal efforts, citing inadequate equipment and challenging topography.
Mayor Paul Coogan announced additional resources for snow removal as the city struggles to clear all streets.
